ingredients.name: Macadamia oil
ingredients.description: Makes the best tasting mayo - Deborah.  Withstands heat well

ingredients.name: Magnesium citrate
ingredients.description: (As a supplement ingredient)

ingredients.name: Magnesium Stearate
ingredients.description: (As a supplement ingredient)

ingredients.name: Maltitol
ingredients.description: Sorbitol, mannitol, and xylitol are all sugar alcohols and are not SCD™ legal. They fall under the category of indigestible carbs and sugars, and so allow companies to label things 'sugar free', even though they are providing nutrition to the bacteria that live in your digestive tract.

ingredients.name: Maltodextrin
ingredients.description: Maltodextrin is the worst of the small molecules of sugars. It is a very short chain of glucose molecules (derived from starch). The chances of digestion are practically nil. It therefore will feed bacteria and because of its particular structure, Elaine feels it is worse than even lactose.

ingredients.name: Mannitol
ingredients.description: Sorbitol, mannitol, and xylitol are all sugar alcohols and are not SCD™ legal. They fall under the category of indigestible carbs and sugars, and so allow companies to label things 'sugar free', even though they are providing nutrition to the bacteria that live in your digestive tract.

ingredients.name: Maple syrup
ingredients.description: Maple syrup is a disaccharide.

ingredients.name: Marshmallow
ingredients.description: It is a mucilaginous herb. Mucilaginous herbs are loaded with starch. This starch is food for the pathogens that the SCD™ is designed to starve out.

ingredients.name: Mead
ingredients.description: If homemade and ingredients are honey and yeast, commercial is likely to have sugar added and is illegal

ingredients.name: Meats
ingredients.description: All fesh or frozen meats with no additives or processing are legal including beef, lamb, pork, liver, kidney, oxtail and tongue

ingredients.name: Meats (processed)
ingredients.description: Most have additives such as starch, lactose and sugar e.g. hot dogs, turkey loaf, spiced ham, bologna, smoked meats.

ingredients.name: Melon
ingredients.description: All types are Legal

ingredients.name: Milk
ingredients.description: Fluid milk of any kind is not permitted.

ingredients.name: Molo-cure
ingredients.description: The main constituent of Molo-cure is aloe. Aloe is not SCD™ compliant as it contains mucilaginous polysaccharides as well as increasing the release of tumor necrosis factor which is associated with IBD inflammation and increased immune stimulation.

ingredients.name: Monterey Jack cheese
ingredients.description: May be used occasionally.

ingredients.name: MSG
ingredients.description: Regardless of whether it is SCD™ legal or not, we should all try to avoid it. MSG can be a potent neurotoxin.

ingredients.name: Mucilaginous Herbs
ingredients.description: Slimy, mucilaginous substances are often prescribed as some think the "coating" properties are helpful to the intestines. They aren't. We who have compromised guts cannot digest this stuff but our bugs can have quite a party on it.

ingredients.name: Mucilaginous Polysaccharides
ingredients.description: Slimy, mucilaginous substances are often prescribed as some think the "coating" properties are helpful to the intestines. They aren't. We who have compromised guts cannot digest this stuff but our bugs can have quite a party on it.

ingredients.name: Muenster cheese
ingredients.description: May be used occasionally.

ingredients.name: Mustard (plain)
ingredients.description: Mustard is legal as long as it doesn't contain illegal ingredients; read the labels carefully.

ingredients.name: Bacon
ingredients.description: Smoked bacon that has been fried very crisply is allowed once per week. There are sugar-free bacons available and if you are able to find a source of sugar-free bacon, you do not have to limit your consumption to once per week. Usually the low sodium varieties do not contain sugar but check the labels carefully.

ingredients.name: Baker's yeast
ingredients.description: Saccharamyces cerevisae is baker's yeast and is illegal.

ingredients.name: Baking powder
ingredients.description: Has starch as an ingredient, (usually corn starch) and other illegals to make it rise better.

ingredients.name: Balsamic vinegar
ingredients.description: It's not that balsamic vinegar is illegal, it's that what you can get in the store isn't really balsamic vinegar and most have sugar added to them so Elaine doesn't allow it. You can make your own legal substitute though see scdrecipe

ingredients.name: Bananas
ingredients.description: They must be ripe with black spots on the skin.

ingredients.name: Bark tea
ingredients.description: Bark tea (Pau d'Arco) contains steroidal saponins and is both an immune booster and a laxative.

ingredients.name: Bean flour
ingredients.description: Do not use ready made flours made from beans or lentils as they probably weren't soaked prior to grinding to bean flour -

ingredients.name: Beef
ingredients.description: Fresh and frozen are allowed as long as nothing has been added during processing; check the labels carefully.

ingredients.name: Bee Pollen
ingredients.description: Pollen is irritating to a damaged gut. Clear, pure, pasteurized honey is okay. Cloudy honey (still containing the pollen) should be avoided. - Sheila

ingredients.name: Berries
ingredients.description: Berries of all kinds are legal.

ingredients.name: Bhindi
ingredients.description: No okra (bhindi) or drumsticks, since they are a mucilaginous food, they are illegal.

ingredients.name: Black beans
ingredients.description: May be tried when symptom free. Dried legumes must be prepared according to the instructions in the book, Breaking the Vicious Cycle.'

ingredients.name: Black radish
ingredients.description: It is very fibrous, so go slowly and be careful.

ingredients.name: Blue cheese
ingredients.description: May be used occasionally.

ingredients.name: Bok Choy
ingredients.description: Bok Choy is much like cabbage and is legal but you should not use a member of the cabbage family until you are well on your way to getting better. In other words, do not use if you still have diarrhea and gas.

ingredients.name: Bouillon cubes
ingredients.description: Bouillon cubes and instant soup bases are not permitted.

ingredients.name: Bourbon
ingredients.description: Only have it occasionally.

ingredients.name: Brazil nuts
ingredients.description: Nuts sold in mixtures are not allowed, as most are roasted with a starch coating.

ingredients.name: Brick cheese
ingredients.description: May be used freely.

ingredients.name: Brie cheese
ingredients.description: May be used occasionally.

ingredients.name: Burdock root
ingredients.description: It contains inulin (FOS) and mucilage.

ingredients.name: Dates
ingredients.description: Medjool and California dates are allowed. They must be loose and not have anything added.

ingredients.name: Date sugar
ingredients.description: May be tried after being on the diet for quite sometime and symptom free but it is not recommended.

ingredients.name: Decaffeinated Products
ingredients.description: Decaffeinated products are not legal since the manufacturing process may introduce questionable ingredients or reactions..

ingredients.name: Dextrose (contained in commercial products)
ingredients.description: The problem with the dextrose and fructose which is being sold as a granulated form as well as the dextrose contained in commercial products is that it is not pure dextrose which should be the same as the single sugar glucose found in fruits and honey.

ingredients.name: Drumsticks
ingredients.description: No okra (bhindi) or drumsticks. Since they are a mucilaginous food, they are illegal.

ingredients.name: Dry Curd Cottage Cheese (DCCC)
ingredients.description: DCCC sources

ingredients.name: Durum Flour
ingredients.description: Its a type wheat grain flour

ingredients.name: Feta Cheese
ingredients.description: Feta may be used after about 6 months of improvement. But used only in small amounts.

ingredients.name: Figs
ingredients.description: Figs unpolluted by chemicals or additives are fine, however I find them, especially in dried form; to be a laxative. They also contain hundreds of tiny hard seeds which can be hard on the intestines. I'm still unable to tolerate them after almost a year on the SCD. If I were you I'd leave figs until you've been symptom free for at least a while. - Rob B

ingredients.name: Filberts (hazelnuts)
ingredients.description: Nuts sold in mixtures are not allowed, as most are roasted with a starch coating. Nuts should only be used as nut flour, in recipes, until diarrhea has subsided.

ingredients.name: Fish
ingredients.description: Fresh and frozen are allowed as long as nothing has been added during processing; check the labels carefully.

ingredients.name: Flax seed
ingredients.description: see Flax seed and flax seed oil

ingredients.name: Flax seed oil
ingredients.description: see Flax seed and flax seed oil

ingredients.name: FOS
ingredients.description: Also known as fructooligosaccharides. See, FOS

ingredients.name: Fowl
ingredients.description: All types including turkey, chicken, duck, goose, pheasant, pigeon etc

ingredients.name: Frozen Orange Juice (concentrated)
ingredients.description: If orange juice is just frozen and has no additives then it is legal, however frozen orange juice is normally concentrated before freezing and the process to concentrate it makes it illegal see frozen orange juice processing

ingredients.name: Fruits (canned)
ingredients.description: Fruits canned in their own juice are allowed.

ingredients.name: Echinacea
ingredients.description: Especially if it is in Alcohol, but even it is in pill form with a bit of lactose. It can be very helpful if a cold or flu is coming on.

ingredients.name: Edam cheese
ingredients.description: May be used occasionally.

ingredients.name: EMPower
ingredients.description: Has many Illegal ingredients, Brown Rice Bran, FOS, Bifidus, flax seed

ingredients.name: Ethanol
ingredients.description: Ethanol is alcohol - the kind in gin, etc.

ingredients.name: Evaporated cane juice
ingredients.description: Fancy name for sugar

ingredients.name: Ezekiel Bread
ingredients.description: Sprouted grain breads are illegal.

ingredients.name: Garfava flour
ingredients.description: Made from two types of beans, Garbanzo beans and Fava beans, neither are SCD™legal.

ingredients.name: Garlic
ingredients.description: Use fresh garlic; garlic powders have starch added as anti-caking agents. You may also make your own garlic powder from fresh garlic by dehydrating it and grinding it yourself.

ingredients.name: Gelatin (unflavored)
ingredients.description: It is a denatured protein that has lost its tertiary structure although it is not the best protein.

ingredients.name: Ghee
ingredients.description: It's clarified butter

ingredients.name: Gin
ingredients.description: Only have it occasionally.

ingredients.name: Glucose candy
ingredients.description: Contains granulated glucose is known to contains other sugars in addition to glucose.

ingredients.name: Glycerin
ingredients.description: Since glycerin is not a sugar to begin with, the "ol" at the end does not make it a sugar alcohol. Glycerin is considered to belong to the fat family. So does glycerol.

ingredients.name: Glycerol
ingredients.description: Since glycerin is not a sugar to begin with, the "ol" at the end does not make it a sugar alcohol. Glycerin is considered to belong to the fat family. So does glycerol.

ingredients.name: Goatein
ingredients.description: It is a Protein powders that contains Bifidobacteria Bifidum.  Protein Powders are a bad idea in any case as they're generally oxidized cholesterol - damaged by heat. - Deborah

ingredients.name: Gorgonzola cheese
ingredients.description: May be used occasionally.

ingredients.name: Gouda cheese
ingredients.description: May be used occasionally.

ingredients.name: Granulated glucose
ingredients.description: It is known to contains other sugars in addition to glucose.

ingredients.name: Grapefruit juice
ingredients.description: Only legal if fresh. Frozen, or canned grapefruit juice is not allowed. Juice should be diluted with water before drinking.

ingredients.name: Grape juice
ingredients.description: White or dark grape juice is allowed. We use Welch's bottled grape juice, as it has been checked out and does not have sugar added. Avoid frozen grape juice, it usually has sugar added. Juice should be diluted with water before drinking.

ingredients.name: Green tea
ingredients.description: Limited to 2 cups per day.

ingredients.name: Gums
ingredients.description: All gums are illegal.

ingredients.name: Agar-agar
ingredients.description: wikipedia:agar-agar

ingredients.name: Algae
ingredients.description: We do not use algae (Spirulina) because IBD involves the immune system and algae can aggravate an already disturbed immune system.

ingredients.name: Allspice
ingredients.description: As long as you're just using Allspice as a cooking spice, it's legal. Don't use the oil, see Allspice

ingredients.name: Almond butter
ingredients.description: Almond butter with no sugar added is allowed.

ingredients.name: Almond milk
ingredients.description: May be tried after being on the diet for 6 months.

ingredients.name: Almonds
ingredients.description: Nuts sold in mixtures are not allowed, as most are roasted with a starch coating. Nuts should only be used as nut flour, in recipes, until diarrhea has subsided.

ingredients.name: Aloe Vera
ingredients.description: It contains mucilaginous polysaccharides as well as increasing the release of tumor necrosis factor which is associated with IBD inflammation and increased immune stimulation.

ingredients.name: Amaranth flour
ingredients.description: Amaranth is a grain substitute, contains starches and so is not allowed.

ingredients.name: Apple Cider
ingredients.description: It is brown and not clear as apple juice is. It should be just straight pressed apples. It is usually pasteurized in order to kill bacteria. Cider should be diluted with water before drinking.

ingredients.name: Apple Juice
ingredients.description: Apple juice usually has sugar added during processing. Apple cider is allowed. It should be brown and not clear as apple juice is. Cider should be diluted with water before drinking.

ingredients.name: Arrowroot
ingredients.description: It is a mucilaginous herb. Mucilaginous herbs are loaded with starch. This starch is food for the pathogens that the SCD™ is designed to starve out.

ingredients.name: Artichokes (French)
ingredients.description: They are the green artichokes that you steam, then dip the leaves in lemon butter and scrape off with your teeth. They have edible hearts and an inedible choke. See, http://aggie-horticulture.tamu.edu/extension/specialty/globe.html for a picture.

ingredients.name: Artichokes (Jerusalem)
ingredients.description: They are actually a tuber, and are not legal. See, http://aggie-horticulture.tamu.edu/extension/specialty/jerusale.html for a picture.

ingredients.name: Ascorbic acid
ingredients.description: Should be nothing but Vitamin C.

ingredients.name: Asiago cheese
ingredients.description: May be used occasionally.

ingredients.name: Asparagus
ingredients.description: Fresh or frozen is allowed. Canned vegetables are not allowed.

ingredients.name: Aspartame
ingredients.description: When symptom free, one aspartame sweetened soft drink per week is allowed - Elaine. But see Aspartame

ingredients.name: Astragalus
ingredients.description: contains polysaccharides

ingredients.name: Avocado oil
ingredients.description: Good for mayonaise and salad dressings but might not withstand heat very well

ingredients.name: Ham
ingredients.description: Only if cured with salt, it is illegal if cured with sugar dextrose etc see Ham

ingredients.name: Haricot beans
ingredients.description: These are legal and are the same as navy beans. Dried legumes must be prepared according to the instructions in the book, Breaking the Vicious Cycle.

ingredients.name: Havarti cheese
ingredients.description: May be used freely.

ingredients.name: Hazelnuts (filberts)
ingredients.description: Nuts sold in mixtures are not allowed, as most are roasted with a starch coating. Nuts should only be used as nut flour, in recipes, until diarrhea has subsided.

ingredients.name: Homemade yogurt
ingredients.description: See, Yoghurt for instructions on how to make legal yogurt.

ingredients.name: Horseradish sauce
ingredients.description: If homemade, if manufactured only if you know they have not added illegals

ingredients.name: Hot dogs
ingredients.description: Commercially produced hotdogs will normally be illegal but here is a legal recipe on SCDiet by Marilyn

ingredients.name: Hydrolyzed Protein
ingredients.description: This is another term for MSG. Regardless of whether it is SCD™ legal or not, we should all try to avoid it. MSG can be a potent neurotoxin.

ingredients.name: Natural cheeses
ingredients.description: See the appendix of the book, Breaking the Vicious Cycle, for a complete list of allowable cheeses.

ingredients.name: Natural Flavors
ingredients.description: "Natural flavoring" can be used to refer to anything, including the chemicals coming from big "flavor" companies which sell chemicals to food processors.

ingredients.name: Navy beans
ingredients.description: Dried legumes must be prepared according to the instructions in the book, Breaking the Vicious Cycle.

ingredients.name: Nettles
ingredients.description: Adverse effects from consuming nettle tea can range from upset stomach to burning sensations in the skin, difficulty in urination and bloating.

ingredients.name: Kefir
ingredients.description: See, Kefir

ingredients.name: Ketchup
ingredients.description: Commercially prepared ketchup contains sugar and is not allowed. See the gourmet section of the book, Breaking the Vicious Cycle for a ketchup recipe.

ingredients.name: Kidney beans
ingredients.description: (All Types) May be tried when symptom free. Dried legumes must be prepared according to the instructions in the book, Breaking the Vicious Cycle.

ingredients.name: Kimchi
ingredients.description: See Kimchi

ingredients.name: Kohlrabi
ingredients.description: see Kohlrabi

ingredients.name: Kudzu (or kuzu)
ingredients.description: It is a mucilaginous herb. Mucilaginous herbs are loaded with starch. This starch is food for the pathogens that the SCD™ is designed to starve out.

ingredients.name: V8 Juice
ingredients.description: It has tomato paste listed as an ingredient. Elaine has listed tomato paste as being illegal. It is also made from concentrate and has added sugar.

ingredients.name: Vanillin
ingredients.description: But not in concentrated form see Vanillin

ingredients.name: Vegetables (canned)
ingredients.description: Canned vegetables are not permitted; they must either be fresh or frozen.

ingredients.name: Vegetable stearate
ingredients.description: I believe that stearate is always a fat (stearic acid) so vegetable stearate would be a fat from some vegetable like coconut, etc. -- Elaine

ingredients.name: Vinegar
ingredients.description: Red and white wine vinegar also white and cider vinegars are allowed but check the label for added illegals. Balsamic vinegar is not allowed as it has added sugar. However you can make your own legal balsamic vinegar substitute see scdrecipe

ingredients.name: Vodka
ingredients.description: Only have it occasionally.

ingredients.name: Lactaid Milk
ingredients.description: The rate of flow of galactose to the liver when one drinks lactose hydrolyzed milk is high. With lactose hydrolyzed milk, you are ingesting the two sugars: glucose and galactose at the same time. Note: Lactaid Milk is Lactose Hydrolyzed Milk

ingredients.name: Lactose Hydrolyzed Milk
ingredients.description: The rate of flow of galactose to the liver when one drinks lactose hydrolyzed milk is high. With lactose hydrolyzed milk, you are ingesting the two sugars: glucose and galactose at the same time. Note: Lactaid Milk is Lactose Hydrolyzed Milk

ingredients.name: Lamb
ingredients.description: Fresh and frozen are allowed as long as nothing has been added during processing; check the labels carefully.

ingredients.name: Lecithin
ingredients.description: Derived from soy (illegal). There is plenty of good lecithin in egg yolks, and Elaine sees no particular need to take it outside of a whole food.

ingredients.name: Lentils
ingredients.description: Dried legumes must be prepared according to the instructions in the book, Breaking the Vicious Cycle.

ingredients.name: Lettuce
ingredients.description: All varieties of lettuce are legal.

ingredients.name: leucine
ingredients.description: (supplement ingredient)

ingredients.name: Licorice
ingredients.description: Licorice is both a demulcent and a laxative. For more info on demulcents see, Licorice and Demulcents

ingredients.name: Lignin
ingredients.description: Grinding lignin and tough stuff does not prevent certain microorganisms from thanking you for chewing up their nutrition. The little buggers then respond by eating faster and making more babies and toxins.

ingredients.name: Lima beans
ingredients.description: Dried or fresh are permitted. Dried legumes must be prepared according to the instructions in the book, Breaking the Vicious Cycle.

ingredients.name: Limburger cheese
ingredients.description: May be used occasionally.

ingredients.name: L-Theanine
ingredients.description: It is an amino acid, as long as its pure without illegal binders, etc its legal, as with any new food go slow introducing it. - Seth

ingredients.name: Agar-agar
ingredients.description: wikipedia:agar-agar

ingredients.name: Algae
ingredients.description: We do not use algae (Spirulina) because IBD involves the immune system and algae can aggravate an already disturbed immune system.

ingredients.name: Allspice
ingredients.description: As long as you're just using Allspice as a cooking spice, it's legal. Don't use the oil, see Allspice

ingredients.name: Almond butter
ingredients.description: Almond butter with no sugar added is allowed.

ingredients.name: Almond milk
ingredients.description: May be tried after being on the diet for 6 months.

ingredients.name: Almonds
ingredients.description: Nuts sold in mixtures are not allowed, as most are roasted with a starch coating. Nuts should only be used as nut flour, in recipes, until diarrhea has subsided.

ingredients.name: Aloe Vera
ingredients.description: It contains mucilaginous polysaccharides as well as increasing the release of tumor necrosis factor which is associated with IBD inflammation and increased immune stimulation.

ingredients.name: Amaranth flour
ingredients.description: Amaranth is a grain substitute, contains starches and so is not allowed.

ingredients.name: Apple Cider
ingredients.description: It is brown and not clear as apple juice is. It should be just straight pressed apples. It is usually pasteurized in order to kill bacteria. Cider should be diluted with water before drinking.

ingredients.name: Apple Juice
ingredients.description: Apple juice usually has sugar added during processing. Apple cider is allowed. It should be brown and not clear as apple juice is. Cider should be diluted with water before drinking.

ingredients.name: Arrowroot
ingredients.description: It is a mucilaginous herb. Mucilaginous herbs are loaded with starch. This starch is food for the pathogens that the SCD™ is designed to starve out.

ingredients.name: Artichokes (French)
ingredients.description: They are the green artichokes that you steam, then dip the leaves in lemon butter and scrape off with your teeth. They have edible hearts and an inedible choke. See, http://aggie-horticulture.tamu.edu/extension/specialty/globe.html for a picture.

ingredients.name: Artichokes (Jerusalem)
ingredients.description: They are actually a tuber, and are not legal. See, http://aggie-horticulture.tamu.edu/extension/specialty/jerusale.html for a picture.

ingredients.name: Ascorbic acid
ingredients.description: Should be nothing but Vitamin C.

ingredients.name: Asiago cheese
ingredients.description: May be used occasionally.

ingredients.name: Asparagus
ingredients.description: Fresh or frozen is allowed. Canned vegetables are not allowed.

ingredients.name: Aspartame
ingredients.description: When symptom free, one aspartame sweetened soft drink per week is allowed - Elaine. But see Aspartame

ingredients.name: Astragalus
ingredients.description: contains polysaccharides

ingredients.name: Avocado oil
ingredients.description: Good for mayonaise and salad dressings but might not withstand heat very well

ingredients.name: Sake
ingredients.description: It is not a distilled spirit like Vodka and it is the distillation that removes the illegals - Seth Both sweet and dry sake still have sugar and actually the dry sake has more sugar than the sweet sake but you can't taste it because of the acidity. - Kim

ingredients.name: Salt
ingredients.description: Ordinary iodized table salt, altho it sometimes has dextrose, is legal because it is important to get that iodine

ingredients.name: Sashimi
ingredients.description: (Japanese sushi-style raw fish served all by itself w/o rice)

ingredients.name: saukerkraut
ingredients.description: Only for advanced SCD'ers

ingredients.name: Seaweed
ingredients.description: Seaweed is high in polysaccharides and therefore illegal.

ingredients.name: Seed Butters
ingredients.description: Seed Butters

ingredients.name: Seed Flour
ingredients.description: It is not allowed because the quantity of the flour way surpasses the few seeds that Elaine had in mind when she said "seeds are permissible after 3 months of no symptoms."

ingredients.name: Seeds
ingredients.description: Permissible after 3 months of no symptoms.

ingredients.name: Sesame seeds
ingredients.description: Sesame seeds

ingredients.name: Sharifa
ingredients.description: Also known as custard apple or cherimoya

ingredients.name: Shellfish
ingredients.description: Fresh and frozen are allowed as long as nothing has been added during processing; check the labels carefully.

ingredients.name: Silica
ingredients.description: (supplement ingredient)

ingredients.name: Silicon Dioxide
ingredients.description: (supplement ingredient)

ingredients.name: Slippery elm
ingredients.description: It is a mucilaginous herb. Mucilaginous herbs are loaded with starch. This starch is food for the pathogens that the SCD™ is designed to starve out.

ingredients.name: Smoked meats
ingredients.description: Unless you know with certainty that no sugar has been added during the smoking process, they are not permitted.

ingredients.name: Sodium Benzoate
ingredients.description: (supplement ingredient)

ingredients.name: Sorbitol
ingredients.description: Sorbitol, mannitol, and xylitol are all sugar alcohols and are not SCD™ legal. They fall under the category of indigestible carbs and sugars, and so allow companies to label things 'sugar free', even though they are providing nutrition to the bacteria that live in your digestive tract.

ingredients.name: Soy
ingredients.description: See - Soy

ingredients.name: Soy Lecithin
ingredients.description: Derived from soy (illegal). There is plenty of good lecithin in egg yolks, and Elaine sees no particular need to take it outside of a whole food. Also see Carlsons fish oil

ingredients.name: Soy Sauce
ingredients.description: Soy sauce is a fermented soy product and also contains wheat so it is illegal.

ingredients.name: Spices
ingredients.description: Spices of all kinds may be used, but avoid spice mixtures; buy spices separately.

ingredients.name: Spirulina
ingredients.description: We do not use algae (Spirulina) because IBD involves the immune system and can aggravate an already disturbed immune system.

ingredients.name: Splenda
ingredients.description: There are several reasons why it is illegal, see Splenda

ingredients.name: Split peas
ingredients.description: Dried legumes must be prepared according to the instructions in the book, Breaking the Vicious Cycle.

ingredients.name: Squash
ingredients.description: Both winter and summer squashes are legal.

ingredients.name: Stevia
ingredients.description: It's molecular structure resembles a steroid and the effects are unknown. See, Stevia

ingredients.name: Stilton cheese
ingredients.description: May be used occasionally.

ingredients.name: String beans
ingredients.description: Also called Green Beans

ingredients.name: Sucralose
ingredients.description: There are several reasons why it is illegal, see Splenda

ingredients.name: Sulphates
ingredients.description: When a fruit such as peaches (dried) and coconut is sulphated, it means it has been exposed to sulphur to keep the color from darkening. Some people are allergic to sulphated products but most of us are not bothered by them.

ingredients.name: Swede
ingredients.description: Another name for rutabaga

ingredients.name: Swiss cheese
ingredients.description: May be used freely.

ingredients.name: Quinoa
ingredients.description: Since Quinoa is 60% starch, it is very illegal.

ingredients.name: Yoghurt (commercial)
ingredients.description: Eating commercial yoghurt is not permitted. Commercial yoghurt may be used as a starter for making homemade yogurt. For directions for making yoghurt  see, How to make yoghurt

ingredients.name: Yoghurt (homemade)
ingredients.description: See, yoghurt for instructions on how to make legal yoghurt.

ingredients.name: Cabbage
ingredients.description: You should not use a member of the cabbage family until you are well on your way to getting better. In other words, do not use if you still have diarrhea and gas.

ingredients.name: Camembert cheese
ingredients.description: May be used occasionally.

ingredients.name: Canned fish
ingredients.description: Canned in oil or water is acceptable but check the labels carefully. Do not buy products containing "broth". Usually, the low sodium varieties do not contain "broth".

ingredients.name: Canned fruits
ingredients.description: Fruits canned in their own juice are allowed.

ingredients.name: Canned vegetables
ingredients.description: There are no canned vegetables permitted, they must either be fresh or frozen.

ingredients.name: Canola oil
ingredients.description: Legal, but not recommended.

ingredients.name: Carrageenan
ingredients.description: Carrageenan is seaweed and high in polysaccharides, therefore illegal.

ingredients.name: Cashews
ingredients.description: Nuts sold in mixtures are not allowed, as most are roasted with a starch coating.

ingredients.name: Cauliflower
ingredients.description: Cauliflower is sometimes hard to digest and should be tried cautiously after some progress has been made on the diet.

ingredients.name: Celeriac /celery root
ingredients.description: However, you should go slow and be careful. It is very fibrous, even if it doesn't seem so when you steam it and mash it.

ingredients.name: Cellulose (in supplements)
ingredients.description: Cellulose in your supplements is okay and virtually impossible to avoid.

ingredients.name: Cereals
ingredients.description: However for a hot cereal see SCDrecipe Hot cereal

ingredients.name: Chard
ingredients.description: Chard (red, green, rainbow and swiss). Chard is similar to spinach/celery so it is legal. It also reminds me a bit of the cabbage family so use with caution if gas is still a problem - Elaine

ingredients.name: Cheddar cheese
ingredients.description: May be used freely.

ingredients.name: Cheese
ingredients.description: If a cheese is not a processed cheese (manufactured) but is a cheese that has had a bacterial culture involved with its production and is aged at least 30 days. Elaine says its OK.

ingredients.name: Cherimoya
ingredients.description: Also known as custard apple or sharifa.

ingredients.name: Chestnuts
ingredients.description: May be tried when symptom free. However, if you buy dried chestnuts, soak them and cook them until soft.

ingredients.name: Chevre
ingredients.description: Chevre is illegal, but you can make a close approximation by dripping goat milk yogurt. Directions can be found at http://uclbs.org/recipes/dairy/suegoatcheese.php

ingredients.name: Chewing gum
ingredients.description: Contains things like aspartame, maple or date sugar and other sugar substitutes which are illegal.

ingredients.name: Chickory root
ingredients.description: Chickory root is not legal. In my first book, I suggested that it might be used instead of coffee beans. I have since learned that it contains large amounts of fructooligosaccharides. - Elaine

ingredients.name: Chlorella
ingredients.description: It is a blue-green algae similar to spirulina

ingredients.name: Chocolate
ingredients.description: Dr. Haas advised not to use cocoa or chocolate and this still goes, it isn't just the sugar he was worried about.

ingredients.name: Citric Acid
ingredients.description: Citric acid as an additive is OK

ingredients.name: Cocoa powder
ingredients.description: Dr. Haas advised not to use cocoa or chocolate and this still goes, it isn't just the sugar he was worried about.

ingredients.name: Coconut
ingredients.description: Fresh or unsweetened, shredded coconut and coconut flour are all legal.

ingredients.name: Coconut milk
ingredients.description: May be tried after being on the diet for 6 months.

ingredients.name: Coconut oil
ingredients.description: Withstands heat well, good for frying/cooking,

ingredients.name: Coffee
ingredients.description: Coffee should be made very weak. Instant coffee is not allowed.

ingredients.name: Colby cheese
ingredients.description: May be used freely.

ingredients.name: Collard greens
ingredients.description: Of the cabbage family, introduce late in the diet

ingredients.name: Courgette
ingredients.description: Also known as zucchini

ingredients.name: Cranberry juice
ingredients.description: We use Knudsen’s Just Cranberry juice, as it has been checked out and does not have sugar added. It can be found in most health food stores. Juice should be diluted with water before drinking. Since this is pure cranberry juice it is very tart, you may sweeten it with saccharine or honey or dilute it with legal apple cider instead of water.

ingredients.name: Cream
ingredients.description: It is illegal as it contains lactose. Cream can be added to milk and then fermented to make SCD™24hr yoghurt as the lactsose will be used up in the fermentation. Cream has less lactose than milk and the more fat it contains the less lactose it has.

ingredients.name: Custard apple
ingredients.description: Also known as sharifa or cherimoya

ingredients.name: Cyclamate
ingredients.description: It is actually a better alternative than saccharine, if you can get it, because it has no aftertaste. But it's almost impossible to find by itself, and certainly not available in NA.

ingredients.name: Juice from concentrate
ingredients.description: Juice from concentrate is normally illegal because when it is reconstituted they often add other things (like sugar). Often additives are not listed on the label

ingredients.name: Raisins
ingredients.description: Try them cautiously.

ingredients.name: Rice
ingredients.description: Both brown and white rice are illegal.

ingredients.name: Rice Bran
ingredients.description: Except as a supplement filler as it is mainly oil. If one is taking a supplement which has proven to be efficacious, then the small amount of filler within the supplement will probably not have an adverse effect. - Elaine.

ingredients.name: Romano cheese
ingredients.description: May be used occasionally.

ingredients.name: Roquefort cheese
ingredients.description: May be used occasionally.

ingredients.name: Rutabaga
ingredients.description: Also known as swede It is very fibrous, so go slow and be careful.

ingredients.name: Tabasco sauce
ingredients.description: Only the original red Tabasco sauce, labeled "McIlhenny Company Tabasco Brand Pepper Sauce" is legal but as with all manufactured products check the ingredients. The other Tabasco styles all have sugars and gums added.

ingredients.name: Tamari
ingredients.description: It is made from soy

ingredients.name: Tamarind
ingredients.description: See, Tamarind

ingredients.name: Tapioca
ingredients.description: It is a starch, therefore illegal.

ingredients.name: Taro
ingredients.description: It has much too much starch in it and is very similar to potatoes.

ingredients.name: Tea
ingredients.description: Ordinary black tea is legal but should be made weak. Instant tea,Ojibwa tea (Essiac), many herbal teas, teas made from bark etc are full of polysaccharides and are illegal. Peppermint and spearmint herb teas are legal, and you can make a tea from ginger which is also legal.

ingredients.name: Tofu
ingredients.description: It is made from soy

ingredients.name: tomato
ingredients.description: Canned tomatoes are illegal.

ingredients.name: Tomato juice (canned)
ingredients.description: Should only have salt added. Also see Tomato Juice - canned

ingredients.name: Turbinado
ingredients.description: It is liquid cane sugar, therefore it is illegal.

ingredients.name: Turnips
ingredients.description: In the most recent printing of BTVC (Ninth Printing - May 2002), turnips were moved from the 'allowed' list to the 'not allowed' list.

ingredients.name: Xylitol
ingredients.description: Sorbitol, mannitol, and xylitol are all sugar alcohols and are not SCD™ legal. They fall under the category of indigestible carbs and sugars, and so allow companies to label things 'sugar free', even though they are providing nutrition to the bacteria that live in your digestive tract.

ingredients.name: Walnut oil
ingredients.description: Doesn't withstand heat very well

ingredients.name: Walnuts
ingredients.description: Nuts sold in mixtures are not allowed, as most are roasted with a starch coating. Nuts should only be used as nut flour, in recipes, until diarrhea has subsided.

ingredients.name: Wasabi
ingredients.description: As long as it is in its natural state and hasn't had fillers added by a manufacturer

ingredients.name: whisky
ingredients.description: Only have it occasionally.

ingredients.name: Wine
ingredients.description: Very dry wine is legal. See, Wines for more information on dry wines.

ingredients.name: Zucchini
ingredients.description: Also known as Courgette

ingredients.name: Okra
ingredients.description: No okra (bhindi) or drumsticks, since they are a mucilaginous food, they are illegal.

ingredients.name: Olive oil
ingredients.description: Olive oil withstands heat well, good for frying cookng and is highly recommended.

ingredients.name: Olives
ingredients.description: Olives are legal as long as they do not contain illegal ingredients; read the labels carefully.

ingredients.name: Onions
ingredients.description: Use fresh onions. Onion powders have starch added as anti-caking agents. You may also make your own onion powder from fresh onions by dehydrating them and grinding them yourself.

ingredients.name: Orange juice
ingredients.description: Fresh orange juice that does not have sugar added is allowed. While diarrhea is active, avoid having orange juice in the morning. We use Tropicana's Original Orange Juice, as it has been checked out and does not have sugar added.

ingredients.name: Ice cream
ingredients.description: Commercially prepared ice cream is not allowed. However, there are many wonderful recipes for homemade ice cream.

ingredients.name: Inositol
ingredients.description: Inositol is a sugar alcohol. Sugar alcohols will feed bacteria and that is something we do not want to do. Sugar alcohols generally cause diarrhea but small amounts in supplements are ok - Elaine

ingredients.name: Inulin
ingredients.description: Inulin is a FOS and is illegal, see Inulin

ingredients.name: Iron supplements
ingredients.description: Please do not get vitamins with iron; they encourage all kinds of infections especially in the gut, and iron has had much research done on it re other diseases. No oral iron if you can help it. Just eat the liver pate and if you like liver, eat it at least once a week.

ingredients.name: Isoglucose
ingredients.description: It is a new sweetner likely to be used in many products in future. See Isoglucose

ingredients.name: Pappadum
ingredients.description: They are an Indian snack made from lentils - they're like a chip. Also contains rice flour

ingredients.name: Parmesan cheese
ingredients.description: May be used occasionally.

ingredients.name: Parsnips
ingredients.description: At one time, I had them included in my book but after getting feedback from the inflammatory bowel listserv, I took them off. Some children do well with them; others do not. However, they are pretty good from a carb standpoint and Dr. Haas allowed them. - Elaine

ingredients.name: Pau 'Arco
ingredients.description: Bark tea (Pau d'Arco) contains steroidal saponins and is both an immune booster and a laxative.

ingredients.name: Peanut butter
ingredients.description: Natural peanut butter with no sugar added is allowed.

ingredients.name: Peanuts
ingredients.description: Peanuts in the shell may be tried cautiously after 6 months on the diet if diarrhea is gone. Shelled peanuts are illegal. Nuts sold in mixtures are not allowed, as most are roasted with a starch coating.

ingredients.name: Pecans
ingredients.description: Nuts sold in mixtures are not allowed, as most are roasted with a starch coating. Nuts should only be used as nut flour, in recipes, until diarrhea has subsided.

ingredients.name: Pectin
ingredients.description: It is a polysaccharide which, in the presence of acid and sugar, gels. It is used as a thickener in jams, and occurs naturally in some fruit, like apples. In apples, it's mostly in the peel, and for someone beginning the diet, you normally wouldn't get too much from eating an apple, because you'd peel it. Pectin as an added ingredient is not legal, as it is a complex sugar.

ingredients.name: Peppermint tea
ingredients.description: Some brands out there put in natural flavourings which would make them illegal, so check the ingredients carefully - Charlene

ingredients.name: Peppers
ingredients.description: Green, yellow, and red peppers are permitted. Also jalapeno peppers, habanera peppers, chili peppers, poblano peppers, relleno peppers, etc. are legal.

ingredients.name: Phosphatidylcholine
ingredients.description: Another name for lecithin which is legal. Eggs have a huge amount of this but if you are not eating eggs, perhaps a bit of supplement is fine. - Elaine

ingredients.name: Pickles (dill)
ingredients.description: Dill pickles are legal as long as they do not contain illegal ingredients; read the labels carefully. DILL PICKLES by Elaine Gottschall  http://www.scdiet.net/elainesrecipes.htm

ingredients.name: Pineapple juice
ingredients.description:
fall 2010 update: "The Dole 100% Pineapple juice in the can now adds Vitamins A, C and E. The Vitamin A is bound with cornstarch."
old info: Fresh pineapple juice that does not have sugar added is allowed. We use Dole's unsweetened pineapple juice in the can, as it has been checked out and does not have sugar added. Juice should be diluted with water before drinking.

ingredients.name: Pine nuts
ingredients.description: They are very hard to digest and even grinding them for pesto doesn't make them any easier on your gut. May be tried in small amounts after symptoms have subsided.

ingredients.name: Pinto beans
ingredients.description: Even after soaking they have the wrong kind of starch

ingredients.name: Pistachio nuts
ingredients.description: They are legal, but the skins can be really tough for newbies. And don't get the pink dyed ones, or the salted ones because they can have starch added to them. You can get unsalted, unroasted pistachios at the health food store and then roast them yourself. For instructions see, Pistachio Nuts

ingredients.name: Plantains
ingredients.description: They contain too much starch.

ingredients.name: Polysorbate 80
ingredients.description: See Polysorbate 80

ingredients.name: Pork
ingredients.description: Fresh and frozen are allowed as long as nothing has been added during processing; check the labels carefully.

ingredients.name: Pork Rinds
ingredients.description: Use the plain pork rinds with no added flavourings and check the label carefully to make sure they don't contain illegal ingredients

ingredients.name: Port du Salut cheese
ingredients.description: May be used occasionally.

ingredients.name: Port wine
ingredients.description: Its full of sugar

ingredients.name: Potassium Sorbate
ingredients.description: (supplement ingredient)

ingredients.name: Potatoes
ingredients.description: Both white and sweet potatoes are illegal.

ingredients.name: Poultry
ingredients.description: Fresh and frozen are allowed as long as nothing has been added during processing; check the labels carefully.

ingredients.name: Primal Defense
ingredients.description: See, Primal Defense

ingredients.name: Processed cheeses
ingredients.description: See the appendix of the book, Breaking the Vicious Cycle, for a complete list of illegal cheeses.

ingredients.name: Protein powder
ingredients.description: See, Protein powder

ingredients.name: Provolone cheese
ingredients.description: Although not listed with the other cheeses on page 140 of Breaking the Vicious Cycle, provolone cheese is legal.

ingredients.name: Psyllium husks
ingredients.description: They are loaded with cellulose and lignin which some bacteria thrive on. We accept that the cellulose in vegetables and fruit can be handled OK but a concentrated form such as husks would not be in order.

ingredients.name: Pumpkin
ingredients.description: Fresh pumpkin is legal, canned pumpkin is not allowed. Butternut squash may be used as a substitute for pumpkin in baking.

ingredients.name: Pumpkin (canned)
ingredients.description: Canned pumpkin is illegal. Butternut squash may be substituted for pumpkin in baking.
